content:
Sure, here are some examples of the duration of sunrises in European cities during the winter solstice:

- Stockholm: Located approximately 59 degrees north of the equator, Stockholm experiences a sunrise duration of around 5-6 hours on the day of the winter solstice. On this day, the sun rises in Stockholm at around 8:47 am and sets at around 2:48 pm, resulting in approximately 6 hours of daylight.

- Berlin: Located approximately 52 degrees north of the equator, Berlin experiences a sunrise duration of around 7-8 hours on the day of the winter solstice. On this day, the sun rises in Berlin at around 8:18 am and sets at around 3:53 pm, resulting in approximately 7.5 hours of daylight.

- London: Located approximately 51.5 degrees north of the equator, London experiences a sunrise duration of around 7-8 hours on the day of the winter solstice. On this day, the sun rises in London at around 8:04 am and sets at around 3:53 pm, resulting in approximately 7.5 hours of daylight.

It's worth noting that the sunrise duration can vary based on several factors such as the actual location within the city, weather conditions, and topography. Additionally, the duration of the sunrise can fluctuate slightly from year to year based on the position of the earth in its orbit around the sun.
